snippet.textDisplay: I may have to replay this game someday, without the anticipation of it being a sequel to Chrono Trigger. That almost inevitably led me to being disappointed and I feel like I may have not given it a fair shake. I did like the game even back then, however. What I can say for sure is that Mitsuda created an amazing soundtrack... while also somehow composing one of my most hated battle themes. Dragon's Prayer is one of my favorites and when Mitsuda composed some tracks for Shadow Hearts 1&2, his use of guitar would always remind me of this theme's.
snippet.textOriginal: I may have to replay this game someday, without the anticipation of it being a sequel to Chrono Trigger. That almost inevitably led me to being disappointed and I feel like I may have not given it a fair shake. I did like the game even back then, however. What I can say for sure is that Mitsuda created an amazing soundtrack... while also somehow composing one of my most hated battle themes. Dragon's Prayer is one of my favorites and when Mitsuda composed some tracks for Shadow Hearts 1&2, his use of guitar would always remind me of this theme's.

snippet.textDisplay: I hope that you get to play it again someday. Cross is my favorite game of all time. Listening to "dream from another shore" always makes me feel something magical. Mitsuda's score is a masterpiece.

snippet.textDisplay: I played Chrono Cross first, so I loved the game for its concepts and writing/story (and I really liked Serge a lot, lol) and ... that god damn blue ... without the shadow of Trigger hanging over it.  I loved the OST, too, despite it being one of the first Mitsuda ever composed, I think?  But you're very right about that battle theme, lol.  Not his forte.
snippet.textOriginal: I played Chrono Cross first, so I loved the game for its concepts and writing/story (and I really liked Serge a lot, lol) and ... that god damn blue ... without the shadow of Trigger hanging over it.  I loved the OST, too, despite it being one of the first Mitsuda ever composed, I think?  But you're very right about that battle theme, lol.  Not his forte.

snippet.textDisplay: I was always a fan of the music in Chrono Chross, but that's where it ended. I didn't care much for the story, combat system, and barely the characters. I think the game would have been much better off if it didn't use the Chrono name, or alternatively if it chose to actually be a sequel to one of the best RPG's ever made.
snippet.textOriginal: I was always a fan of the music in Chrono Chross, but that's where it ended. I didn't care much for the story, combat system, and barely the characters. I think the game would have been much better off if it didn't use the Chrono name, or alternatively if it chose to actually be a sequel to one of the best RPG's ever made.

snippet.textDisplay: Played the crap out of both Chrono Cross and Chrono Trigger.  Treated both games as different experiences. Chrono Cross is probably one of the best games I played that explored the whole parallel worlds concept.
snippet.textOriginal: Played the crap out of both Chrono Cross and Chrono Trigger.  Treated both games as different experiences. Chrono Cross is probably one of the best games I played that explored the whole parallel worlds concept.

snippet.textDisplay: Chrono Cross is a great game that gets a bad rap simply because it's not quite what people expected in a Chrono followup. And that's the other issue, I can't in good faith call it a sequel as that implies it has some stronger connection to CT's plot, when really it simply follows up on one story from CT and happens to talk about the after effects of the rest of the cast(it's specifically about Schala and Belthasar). I'd love if we could get either an actual sequel that follows Crono and the gang or directly ties into their game, or if we can't get that then a 3D remake like how we're getting one on Secret of Mana, Final Fantasy VII or what happened with Final Fantasy IV.
snippet.textOriginal: Chrono Cross is a great game that gets a bad rap simply because it's not quite what people expected in a Chrono followup. And that's the other issue, I can't in good faith call it a sequel as that implies it has some stronger connection to CT's plot, when really it simply follows up on one story from CT and happens to talk about the after effects of the rest of the cast(it's specifically about Schala and Belthasar). I'd love if we could get either an actual sequel that follows Crono and the gang or directly ties into their game, or if we can't get that then a 3D remake like how we're getting one on Secret of Mana, Final Fantasy VII or what happened with Final Fantasy IV.

snippet.textDisplay: yeah, its a weird middle ground where its both way too tied into CT, and not tied in enough. i REALLY wish i could like everything about cross, but i cant stand what it did to the nice, simple story of the first game.
snippet.textOriginal: yeah, its a weird middle ground where its both way too tied into CT, and not tied in enough. i REALLY wish i could like everything about cross, but i cant stand what it did to the nice, simple story of the first game.
